Brazosport Water Authority
Executive Summary
a) Brazosport Water Authority release policies are as follows: 1. Utilize written job procedures involving handling of chlorine. 2. All BWA Personnel annually review written procedures. 3. All operations and maintenance personnel are trained (in-house and TECQ classes).  4. All operations and maintenance personnel obtain and maintain a "C" surface water license from TCEQ. 5. All operation and maintenance personnel are annually HAZWOPER certified.  6. Chlorine gas system is vaccum from regulator on the liquid chlorine cylinder to the water aspirator.   

Emegency Response policies are as follows: 1. Notify Lake Jackson Fire Dept. 2. Do not attempt a repair of a leak or rescue without self contained breathing air apparatus. 3. Evacuate all non essential personnel  4. Do not a repair alone. 5. All BWA Personnel are have required HAZWOPER training. 5. All maintenance and operations BWA  Personnel are annually trained and certified on SCBA  6. All maintenance and operations BWA Personnel are Bi-Annually trained and certified in CPR and First Aid via Red Cross. 

b) Brazosport Water Authority maintains liquid chlorine in 2,000 pound cylinders on site for disinfection of drinking water.
Chlorine maximum amount is 24,000 pounds

c) Worst Case release scenario for:
   1. Chemical Chlorine
   2. Physical state: liquid
   3. Basis for results: toxic end point to 0,067 mg/l (RMP* Com)
   4. Scenario: liquid spill and vaporization
   5. Quantity: 2,000 pounds
   6. Release rate: 200 pounds per minute
   7. Release duration: 10 minutes
   8. Wind speed: 3.4 miles per hour
   9 Topography: urban surroundings
 10. Distance to endpoint: 5.4 miles
 11. Public and environmental receptors: 40,750 residents, 10 schools, 1 hospital, 2 prison farms, 11 parks, 4 nursing homes,
      girls scout meeting area, 2 commerical and office areas, golf course and Brazos River Bottoms Wetlands

d) The general accidental release prevention program
   1. All repetitive jobs require a written procedure
   2. All operators and maintenance personnel are trained in release prevention
   3. Require all operators and maintenance personnel to be HAZWOPER trained
   4. Review all chemical carriers for safety and release prevention program
     Accidental release chlorine prevention
   1. All operators and maintenance personnel are trained in release prevention
   2. Only AWWA approved chlorine equipment and materials are utilized
   3. All chlorine handling tasks require a written approved job procedure and annual review
   4. All chlorine carriers are reviewed for accidental release prevention training program
   5. Daily inspection of chlorination system
   6. Daily testing of chlorine leak detection system
   7. Rebuild, test and inspection of all chlorine regulators and chlorine dioxide generators quarterly

  e) Five year accident history
    There have been no reportable accidental releases for chlorine from Brazosport Water Authority
     Water Plant in the past five years.

  e) Planned changes to improve safety
   1. Continue with monthly saftey topic with written modules
   2. Continue to have personnel take TCEQ Safety Classes.
